text: Hauk Buen (11 May 1933 – 1 March 2021) was a Norwegian hardingfele fiddler and fiddle maker. Buen was born in Kongsberg. His best known albums are Fykerudn from 1992 (in cooperation with his brother Knut), which was awarded Spellemannprisen, and Feledåm from 2000. He was awarded the King's Medal of Merit in gold in 2003. Buen has inspired and influenced fiddler Annbjørg Lien, who learned several folk tunes from him. Buen died on 1 March 2020. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Norwegian musical entertainers
title: Hauk Buen
